Key Match Events: Isiah Kiner-Falefa had a go-ahead single in the fifth inning to put the Pirates ahead 3-2.
Billy Cook lined a single to left and scored on a hit and run by Kiner-Falefa.
Kansas City's Brady Singer struggled with command, allowing four runs over five innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Pittsburgh manager Derek Shelton praised Billy Cook's awareness and execution.
Royals manager Matt Quatraro noted Brady Singer's performance and the team's missed opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on Roberto Clemente Day, with players wearing his number 21.
The Royals had the bases loaded with two outs in the sixth inning but couldn't score.
